intro: Erysimum canadense var. glabrescens, commonly known as the Canadian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, while the stem leaves are sessile and alternate. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals and a distinctive yellow-green center, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges, fields, and along roadsides.
